title: On Politics: Rattling Money Out of Congresss Piggy Bank
description: President Trump after signing the latest coronavirus relief package in the Oval Office on Friday.

title: The Loans and the Fury
description: Want this in your inbox each morning? Sign up here.

title: Deaths Dip in N.Y. and N.J. as Reopening Plans Take Shape
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said on Monday that 337 more people had died of the virus in New York State, and Gov. Philip D. Murphy of New Jersey reported an additional 106 deaths.

title: Nancy Pelosi Endorses Joe Biden
description: Nancy Pelosi, the speaker of the House, endorsed Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Monday as the Democratic Party continued to coalesce around its presumptive presidential nominee.

title: Running Backs, Drafted Late, Are Still Coveted in the N.F.L.
description: As the A.F.C.s top seed last season, the Baltimore Ravens charged into the postseason as Super Bowl favorites with a 14-2 record built on a distinct run-first offensive mentality. The Ravens rushed the football 57.5 percent of the time, easily the league high.

title: What Do You Miss Most About Your Life Before the Pandemic?
description: In When Life Felt Normal: Your Pre-Pandemic Moments, Hannah Wise writes:

title: Why Did Cruise Ships Keep Sailing?
description: This article is part of David Leonhardts newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it each weekday.

title: What You Get for $700,000
description: A Long Beach condo in a former Masonic temple, a 1922 bungalow in Petaluma and a cottage in Monrovia.

title: $700,000 Homes in California
description: After sitting empty for a number of years, this 1927 Greek Revival building was converted into condominiums in 2005, and two additional towers were added to form a complex. This unit, on the top level of the 1927 building, has a number of original architectural features, including an exposed-brick wall and a skylight over the master sleeping loft.

title: Louisiana Police Officer Killed in Shooting Before 4-Hour Standoff
description: One police officer was killed and a second critically injured by a gunman in Louisiana on Sunday, in a shooting that started a four-hour standoff between the suspect, SWAT teams and the police, officials said.

title: California Beaches: A (Photo) Study in Contrasts
description: Good morning.

title: Marry Someone Nicer Than You
description: The No. 1 piece of marriage advice I give to my friends is: Marry someone who is nicer than you are. In an ideal world, it means that over time, your natural edges will be sanded down by their kindness.

title: Lesson of the Day: New York and Boston Pigeons Dont Mix
description: Featured Article: New York and Boston Pigeons Dont Mix by Joshua Sokol

title: How Much Do You Know About Myanmar?
description: Can you find Myanmar on a map? What else do you know about this Southeast Asian nation with a population of more than 50 million people?

title: A Pandemic Gives the Funny Pages a Jolt of Reality
description: As the Covid-19 pandemic spread across the world, many in the United States self-quarantined, and thousands of people died, one section of the daily newspaper seemed wholly untouched by the cataclysmic events: The comics pages. Characters carried on much as they ever did  car-pooling, going to school, wandering into neighbors houses. Each comic strip felt like a time capsule from the impossibly faraway era of 2019.

title: C.D.C. Adds New Symptoms to Its List of Possible Covid-19 Signs
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has expanded its list of possible symptoms of the coronavirus, a step that reflects the broad variation and unpredictability in the way the illness can affect individual patients.

title: Jakartas Trash Mountain: When People Are Desperate for Jobs, They Come Here
description: BEKASI, Indonesia  Even in the pouring rain, in the middle of the night, they are out scavenging, wearing headlamps to scan a mountain of rotting garbage more than 15 stories high.

title: Cook Anyway
description: Good morning. One of the greatest first lines of a novel, ever: One evening, it was toward the end of October, Harry Arno said to the woman hed been seeing on and off the past few years, Ive made a decision. Im going to tell you something Ive never told anyone before in my life.

title: Soccer Coach in El Paso Shooting Dies 9 Months Later
description: HOUSTON  A soccer coach who was among those shot at a Walmart in El Paso last year in the deadliest anti-Latino attack in modern American history has died nearly nine months later, bringing the death toll from the shooting to 23.

title: Broadway Adjourns, but the Sing Street Band Plays On
description: Explode the computer with energy, you beautiful people, the director Rebecca Taichman said.

title: Sympathy Cards Are Selling Out
description: The coronavirus pandemic has left retailers scrambling to meet a crushing demand for everything from milk to toilet paper to flour and yeast.

title: Tracking the Coronavirus
description: These eight charts can help us understand the past, present and future of the coronavirus pandemic in the United States.

title: Supreme Court Dismisses Challenge to New York City Gun Ordinance
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court said on Monday that it would not decide what would have been its first decision on the scope of the Second Amendment in almost a decade, finding that New York Citys repeal of the gun control regulation under challenge had made the matter moot.

title: What the Heck Is That?
description: The animation that television and movie viewers see today  where individual hairs can be distinguished on a characters head  is a far cry from the flat, painted cel images people might remember from the cartoons of the 1970s.

title: A Major Trial for Voting Rights in Florida Is Happening on Video Chat
description: MIAMI  Only the judge and a couple of his staff members were in the courtroom when he called the trial to order. The plaintiffs, witnesses and lawyers were at home in front of webcams, awaiting their turns to speak.

title: Afraid to Be a Nurse: Health Workers Under Attack
description: MEXICO CITY  The senior nurse went on national television to make a plea on behalf of her fellow health care workers: Please stop assaulting us.

title: New York Board of Elections Cancels Democratic Presidential Primary
description: New York officials canceled the states Democratic presidential primary on Monday, prompting an immediate backlash from the campaign of Senator Bernie Sanders and his legion of progressive supporters who had hoped to amass convention delegates and help shape the partys platform in August.

title: Supreme Court Rules for Insurers in $12 Billion Obamacare Case
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court ruled Monday that the federal government must live up to its promise to shield insurance companies from some of the risks they took in participating in the exchanges established by President Barack Obamas health care law, the Affordable Care Act.

title: Review: For Sondheims 90th Birthday, a Collage of Aching Voices
description: These ever-surprising songs, mostly written for big Broadway stages, turn out to thrive in close quarters. That was the happy discovery of Take Me to the World: A Sondheim 90th Birthday Celebration, a starry, streaming tribute to Stephen Sondheim that began catastrophically and blossomed into something beautiful.

title: Michelle Obamas Memoir Becoming Will Be a Netflix Documentary
description: Michelle Obama has worn a number of hats over the past several years: first lady, film producer, best-selling author. She now adds a new title to her rsum: Netflix documentary star.

title: No, the Best Doesnt Win
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: Detroit Students Have a Constitutional Right to Literacy, Court Rules
description: For the first time in decades, a federal court has declared that American public school students have a constitutional right to an adequate education.

title: Will Returning Players Be Out of Shape? Soccer May Need More Subs
description: When sports do come back, leagues will be trying to pack in as many revenue-generating games as possible. At the same time, many of the players coming out of quarantine may not exactly be in tiptop shape. That combination could prove troublesome.

title: Top E.R. Doctor Who Treated Virus Patients Dies by Suicide
description: A top emergency room doctor at a Manhattan hospital that treated many coronavirus patients died by suicide on Sunday, her father and the police said.

title: DaBaby Unseats the Weeknd at No. 1
description: When the North Carolina rapper DaBaby first reached No. 1 on Billboards album chart last fall, it was the triumph of a fast-moving newcomer who was a master of meme-ready marketing  that album, Kirk, was the third project in 12 months from a musician who had gotten attention by walking the streets of South by Southwest wearing only jewels and an adult diaper.

title: This Larb Couldnt Be Easier or More Adaptable
description: After a slow, rainy start to the Brooklyn backyard growing season, the mint on my deck is finally powering its way back, taking over the herb box with vim and vigor. I clipped it back to make room for the slower-moving lemon thyme, and ended up with enough to season a batch of Thai larb.

title: In Race for a Coronavirus Vaccine, an Oxford Group Leaps Ahead
description: OXFORD, England  In the worldwide race for a vaccine to stop the coronavirus, the laboratory sprinting fastest is at Oxford University.

title: Arthritis Drug Did Not Help Seriously Ill Covid Patients, Early Data Shows
description: Doctors around the world, trying to save seriously ill coronavirus patients, have been dosing them with rheumatoid arthritis drugs that can squelch immune responses. The theory was that many were dying because their immune systems went into overdrive, creating a fatal storm that attacked their lungs.

title: Harland Svare, 89, Giants Linebacker and Young Head Coach, Dies
description: Harland Svare, who played linebacker in the celebrated defense that helped take the Giants to three N.F.L. championship games in the 1950s and became, at the time, the youngest head coach in the N.F.L.s modern history when the Los Angeles Rams hired him in 1962, died on April 4 at a nursing home in Steamboat Springs, Colo. He was 89.

title: Remembering Mike Huckaby, a Towering Figure in Detroit House Music
description: The death of the Detroit house-music D.J. and producer Mike Huckaby on Friday, at 54, sent a shock wave through the music community he called home. Huckaby  who died from complications of a stroke and Covid-19 at Beaumont Hospital in Detroits Royal Oak suburb  was one of global dance musics most widely beloved figures.

title: Mindy Kalings Netflix Show Tells a New Kind of Story: One Like Hers
description: Mindy Kaling isnt trying to tell everyones story  shes had to break a lot of boundaries just to tell her own.

title: Georgia Cant Copyright Its Entire State Code, the Supreme Court Rules
description: WASHINGTON  Georgia may not copyright its entire official code, which includes both the states laws and annotations interpreting them, the Supreme Court ruled on Monday. The 5-to-4 decision featured unusual alliances and would most likely be widely felt, as about 20 other states have claimed that parts of similar annotated codes are copyrighted.

title: Samin Nosrat Wants Us to Make Lasagna Together
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  For as long as I can remember, gathering people around a table has been a sacred act for me.

title: Boris Johnson, Back on the Job, Urges Caution in Easing Covid-19 Rules
description: LONDON  A pale but vigorous-sounding Prime Minister Boris Johnson returned to work on Monday, declaring that the coronavirus that nearly killed him was like an unexpected and invisible mugger the British people had begun to wrestle to the floor but had not yet fully disabled.

title: New Jersey Governor Offers Timeline to Begin Reopening Within Weeks
description: Gov. Philip D. Murphy on Monday sketched out benchmarks New Jersey will have to reach before the coronavirus lockdown can be lifted, even as he warned of a financial Armageddon that could leave the state unable to pay its teachers, firefighters and police officers.

title: Diagnosing and Treating Covid-19
description: To the Editor:

title: Films to Heal a Broken Moment
description: As endings go, the one invented by the Swedish director Lukas Moodysson for his gentle, unassuming comedy Together (2001) is just about perfect. Its not a spoiler to share it: Already, the members of a 1975 commune have squabbled over everything from eating meat to owning a TV and the need for wearing underwear in the kitchen. Their children, often the most mature people in the room, look on, mortified. One morning after the worst of the infighting has ended, everybody heads outside for a sloppy, impromptu soccer match under a light snowfall  adults and kids, women and men, socialists and materialists. In the chaos of the game, all is forgiven.

title: Covid-19: Lessons From the Yanomami
description: The Yanomami people are no strangers to fatal epidemics, and yet on April 9, many around the world were shocked to learn that Covid-19 had taken its first victim among this relatively isolated Indigenous people of the Amazon rainforest along the Brazil-Venezuela border.

title: We Cant Police Our Way Out of a Pandemic
description: This month, Philadelphia transit police officers violently forced a man off a bus for not wearing a mask. In New York, Gov. Andrew Cuomo raised the maximum fine from $500 to $1,000 for breaking social-distancing protocols, and Mayor Bill de Blasio has deployed Police Department officers to enforce them and make arrests. In Kentucky, judges are ordering people who have tested positive for the coronavirus and have broken quarantine to be fitted with ankle monitors  with the threat of arrest if they leave their homes. In Florida, a judge ruled that people arrested for breaking quarantine can be held without bail.

title: Mitch McConnell Has No Idea What Bankruptcy Actually Means
description: Cities across the country are facing a red-ink cascade. On April 22, Mitch McConnell recommended that cities and states try bankruptcy if theyre struggling during the coronavirus pandemic. This is a terrible idea, and we dont need to look farther than Detroit to see why.

title: Hurricanes Are Reshaping Evolution Across the Caribbean
description: Two years ago, Colin Donihue, a biologist, released a sober scientific paper along with a series of endlessly GIF-able videos. They showed Caribbean anole lizards flailing in the wind from a leaf blower, holding on to a stick for dear life, not unlike the kitten in the classic Hang In There, Baby poster.

title: Commissioner Resigns After He Threw a Cat During Zoom Meeting
description: The city Planning Commission meeting in Vallejo, Calif., last week followed the same humdrum pattern of so many municipal meetings: There was the Pledge of Allegiance and a roll call, followed by various reports.

title: Bernard Gersten, Offstage Star of Nonprofit Theater, Dies at 97
description: Bernard Gersten, a canny executive who helped turn two of New Yorks nonprofit theater companies into powerhouse producers and presenters of award-winning plays and musicals, died on Monday at his home in Manhattan. He was 97. The cause was pancreatic cancer, his daughter Jenny Gersten said.

title: New Zealand, U.S. Coronavirus Deaths, Kim Jong-un: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: In Rare Admission, U.S. Military Says Strikes Killed 2 Civilians in Somalia
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon acknowledged on Monday that an American military strike in Somalia more than a year ago killed two civilians and injured three more.

title: The Lightest, Brothiest Soup for When You Cant Eat Another Bite
description: Even a person as enthusiastic as I am about home cooking can feel fatigue, and six going on seven weeks of this quarantine, I am feeling it. Its not so much the cooking. Its the eating  probably because I am doing it all day long.

title: Francisco Mendez, Boxing Gym Owner and Mentor, Dies at 61
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: In Seoul, the Art World Gets Back to Business
description: SEOUL  I wouldnt say things are totally back to normal, explained Passion Lim, taking in the scene on Thursday at the opening for Billy Childish paintings at the Lehmann Maupin gallery. But its a start, he added.

title: Only Children Are Not Doomed
description: In the home school Im running here in quarantine, recess starts at 9:30 a.m. sharp. My two kids go outside while I watch them through a window on conference calls. Every day, I spend about half the time thinking its so great they have each other (during the game try to distract mom) and half the time forcibly separating them (during the game fight with sticks).

title: Get the Kids Back to School. Please!
description: To the Editor:

title: Bruce Myers, Actor With Voice of a Stradivarius, Dies at 78
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: Airlines and Hotels Reach Out to Their Top Spenders
description: Lets just say that no one is likely to earn airline or hotel elite status this year, not with travel dropping to near nothing and no resumption in sight.

title: Win 30 Minutes With a Chef
description: Chefs and food writers are up for grabs, for a price. Winners in this online auction will get a 30-minute one-on-one with the chef or writer. The #AskChefsAnything auction starts Wednesday at 10 a.m. and continues through 8 p.m. on May 3, when the winning bidders will be announced. The minimum bid is $100. The funds raised in New York will be used to help immigrant workers and their families in the Bronx (through the Mercy Center). Other cities have come onboard, including Los Angeles (auction begins May 6) and Philadelphia (May 13), and their aid workers will also be beneficiaries. Among the experts up for auction are Eric Ripert, Enrique Olvera, Alex Raij, Danny Bowien, Dana Cowin, Jody Williams, Riad Nasr, Dan Kluger, Dan Barber, Einat Admony and Justin Smillie.

title: A Cast Album I Love: The Secret Garden
description: Recently, The Timess co-chief theater critics put together a musical cast recording starter kit for those of us stuck at home  10 cast albums theyd take with them to a desert island. We asked some of their fellow critics to pick one cast album each and extol its pleasures. Laura Collins-Hughes wrote about the Shakespeare in the Park production of Twelfth Night and Elisabeth Vincentelli sang the praises of Hair.

title: N.Y.C. Deaths Reach 6 Times the Normal Level, Far More Than Coronavirus Count Suggests
description: There have been some 20,000 more deaths than would be expected over all, and thousands more than have been captured in the citys official coronavirus statistics.

title: Brooklyn Kitchen Takes Its Cooking Classes Online
description: For the pandemic, Taylor Erkkinen, an owner of the Brooklyn Kitchen, has taken her cooking classes online. But, like the hands-on courses she was giving in her Industry City kitchen studio, they are limited to 20 students. Theyre held on Zoom so students can ask questions and get answers in real time. On Saturday at noon, shell teach a brunch class with a menu of granola, poached eggs with hollandaise, hash, Dutch baby pancakes and Bloody Marys. Before you sign up, you are told what ingredients and equipment youre required to have on hand.

title: Marmalades Make a Mothers Day Gift
description: Marmalade lovers can rejoice. Even in pandemic seclusion, the morning toast or late afternoon plate of cheese can glow with the citric sunshine of bittersweet Seville orange, rich blood orange, fragrant Cara Cara orange or tangy Meyer lemon. Laura OBrien, the preserver who owns Josephines Feast, has introduced a gift box with 8-ounce jars of all four varieties, suitable for Mothers Day.

title: Chocolates for Quarantine Teatime
description: The theme that the Manhattan chocolatier Joan Coukos, of Chocolat Moderne, has selected for this collection of bonbons is English desserts. Each of the candies, decorated with a flower, has a creamy filling to evoke teatime at Claridges: sticky toffee; trifle, with raspberry and marzipan; and banoffee pie, with salted caramel and banana ganache.

title: Stocks and a Jar Full of Soup Mix-Ins
description: The chef Marco Canora, who owns Hearth in the East Village and who has also opened a string of Brodo storefronts selling broth (brodo in Italian), has created new soup kits for pickup and limited delivery from the Brodo shops. They consist of big Instagram-friendly jars layered with ingredients like cooked grains, pulses, vegetables, greens and seasonings, including sofrito, the base made with carrots, celery onions and garlic. Add them to a simmering pot of one of Mr. Canoras plain beef, chicken or mushroom broths, and you have hearty soup for two to four. Bolster them with slivers of meat, tofu or chicken, if you like. Individual containers of Brodo broths are also sold frozen for delivery nationwide.

title: Job or Health? Restarting the Economy Threatens to Worsen Economic Inequality
description: WASHINGTON  Efforts to quickly restart economic activity risk further dividing Americans into two major groups along socioeconomic lines: one that has the power to control its exposure to the coronavirus outbreak and another that is forced to choose between potential sickness or financial devastation.

title: Attorney General Sees Too Much Secrecy in Epstein Estate
description: Some of the same furtive techniques that Jeffrey Epstein employed in life are showing up in the litigation over dividing up the wealth he left behind when he died.

title: The Chef Hooni Kim Discusses His New Book
description: The Korea Society, a New York-based nonprofit organization that promotes cultural exchange with South Korea, is celebrating the chef Hooni Kim, who owns Danji and Hanjan in Manhattan. The food writer Andrew Friedman will interview Mr. Kim about his new book, My Korea: Traditional Flavors, Modern Recipes, on a free webcast Thursday at 6:30 p.m., hosted by the society.

title: Everyone Is Giving Away Cash on Instagram
description: On March 18, as states sent nonessential workers home and companies prepared to cut costs, the fitness influencer Paige Hathaway posted a message to her more than 4 million followers on Instagram.

title: Behind the Wheel, Women Are Safer Drivers Than Men
description: Women tend to be better drivers than men  much better, judging by the number of deaths they cause on the road.

title: Leandro Barbosas Family Grew During the Pandemic
description: Leandro Barbosa had lofty goals for 2020. After playing 14 seasons in the N.B.A., Barbosa had hoped to make one more trip to the Olympics with Brazils national basketball team  his third  at age 37.

title: Watch This: Never Have I Ever
description: Every Monday, Wednesday and Friday, our TV critic Margaret Lyons offers hyper-specific viewing recommendations in our Watching newsletter. Read her latest picks below, and sign up for the Watching newsletter here.

title: Israelis and Palestinians Remember the Slain, Home Alone or Online En Masse
description: JERUSALEM  Civil-defense sirens sounded at 8 p.m. to mark the start of Israels solemn Memorial Day observance, but unlike in ordinary years, when the moment is marked by a sudden halt to traffic and an abrupt quieting of nightlife, Monday nights remembrance of fallen soldiers or victims of terrorism came with most of the country already on lockdown.

title: It Was Just Too Much: How Remote Learning Is Breaking Parents
description: Daniel Levins son, Linus, 7, was supposed to be doing math. Instead, he pretended to take a shower in the living room, rubbing a dry eraser under his arms like a bar of soap, which upset his 5-year-old sister, distracting her from her coloring.

title: Donald Trump: Who He Is and What He Stands For
description: The 45th president, a deeply divisive leader, was running for re-election on immigration, trade and the economy. Then the coronavirus crisis hit.

title: Quarantine Fatigue Has More People Going Outside
description: For more than a month, governors in a vast majority of states have urged people to stay indoors and away from one another, critical measures needed to slow the spread of the coronavirus.

title: Driver Rams 2 Police Motorcyclists in a Paris Suburb
description: PARIS  A motorist deliberately drove his car into two police motorcyclists on patrol in a Paris suburb on Monday, gravely injuring both, police unions said. One of the officers sustained a fractured skull and has been placed in a medically induced coma.

title: Harold Reid, Bedrock Voice of the Statler Brothers, Dies at 80
description: Harold Reid, whose resonant bass, comic touch and business acumen helped make the Statler Brothers a top-grossing touring act and a steady presence on the country music charts for decades, died on Friday at his home in Staunton, Va. He was 80.

title: Small Business, Texas, Vaccine: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Peacocks and Vultures Are Circling the Deficit
description: Almost a decade has passed since I published a column, Myths of Austerity, warning that deficit alarmism would delay recovery from the Great Recession  which it did. Unfortunately, that kind of alarmism seems to be making a comeback.

title: Bankers Rebuke S.B.A. as Loan System Crashes in Flood of Applications
description: Minutes after a $310 billion aid program for small companies opened for business on Monday, the online portal for submitting applications crashed. And it kept crashing all day, much to the frustration of bankers around the country who were trying  and failing  to apply on behalf of desperate clients.

title: Does the Biden Bump Have More to Do With Trump?
description: Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox every weekday.

title: In Kayleigh McEnany, Trump Taps a Press Fighter for the Coronavirus Era
description: [Follow our live Trump vs Biden 2020 election updates and analysis.]

title: Republicans, Who Do You Think Is Bailing Out Your State?
description: As negotiations over the next coronavirus relief package heat up, a key point of contention  perhaps the key point  is whether Congress will provide meaningful aid to struggling state and local governments.

title: Briefings Were Not Worth the Time, Trump Said. But He Couldnt Stay Away.
description: WASHINGTON  To the surprise of exactly no one, President Trump resumed his daily coronavirus news briefings on Monday, just two days after tweeting that they were not worth the time & effort and just hours after his own White House officially canceled the planned appearance.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: Heres promising news in the worldwide race to develop a vaccine to ward off the coronavirus. The Jenner Institute at Oxford University has one that seems to work in lab animals and is ready to test its effectiveness in humans, if regulators approve.

title: Reopening Plans Across U.S. Are Creating Confusing Patchwork
description: DENVER  Governors across the country forged ahead Monday with plans to reopen their economies, even as the nation hit a grim milestone of 50,000 deaths from the coronavirus and public health experts warned against lifting stay-at-home orders too quickly.

title: Officials Say Limits on Virus Relief Funds for States Are Too Tight
description: WASHINGTON  Lawmakers and state officials say the Trump administration is unreasonably restricting how local governments can spend federal aid as they struggle to stay afloat during the pandemic and Republicans raise doubts about providing added financial relief to hard-pressed communities.

title: Trump Disinfectant Remarks Echo Claims by Miracle-Cure Quacks
description: President Trumps public statements about using disinfectants to potentially treat the coronavirus have put him in the company of pseudoscientists and purveyors of phony elixirs who promote and sell industrial bleach as a miracle cure for autism, malaria and a long list of medical conditions.

title: Trump Vows More Coronavirus Testing, but Less Than What May Be Needed
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump, under growing pressure to expand coronavirus testing as states move to reopen their economies, unveiled a new plan on Monday to ramp up the federal governments help to states, but his proposal runs far short of what most public health experts say is necessary.

title: John Grisham Returns to Camino Island, This Time in Hurricane Season
description: Three years ago, John Grisham came up with a new formula for success. He ditched the lawyers to write an actual beach book, sand and all. This wouldnt be much of a departure for some authors, but coming from Grisham it was a delightful surprise  all the more so because the sand was on the fictitious Camino Island, a Florida resort featuring one of the worlds great bookstores, stolen F. Scott Fitzgerald manuscripts, a colony of gossipy writers and a lot of languid vacation time. It also starred a woman, Mercer Mann, who put the book squarely in Reese Witherspoon country.

title: La Vie en Rose
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Maybe you solve your crossword puzzles and then just go about your day, but I am a highly suggestible person and find that all sorts of things bubble up for me as I fill in the squares. And they tend to stay with me.

title: New York Attorney General Scrutinizes Amazon for Firing Warehouse Worker
description: SEATTLE  Amazon may have violated federal worker safety laws and New York States whistle-blower protections when it fired an employee from its Staten Island warehouse who protested the companys response to the coronavirus outbreak, according to a letter the office of the New York attorney general, Letitia James, sent the company last week.

title: Corrections: April 28, 2020
description: An article on April 19 about life during the next year of the pandemic misidentified the source of an epidemiological model that estimated the United States would suffer 100,000 to 240,000 deaths during the coronavirus epidemic. The estimate was made by the White House, not the University of Washingtons Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation.

title: Quotation of the Day: Truly in the Trenches, Doctor Dies by Suicide
description: Make sure shes praised as a hero, because she was. Shes a casualty just as much as anyone else who has died.

title: 2 Sought $4 Million for Face Masks That Didnt Exist, U.S. Says
description: They wanted $4 million for a stockpile of face masks, but prosecutors say that the protective gear advertised by two Southern California men did not exist, and that they went as far as to put fake 3M labels on empty boxes.

title: European Soccer Tries to Find a Way Back, or a Way Out
description: At least, it seemed, the Dutch had made a decision. Alone among Europes soccer leagues, they now had some clarity about what the immediate future held. On Friday morning, the Netherlands became the first country in Europe to call off its soccer season. There would be no champion crowned, no teams condemned to relegation. It was over.

title: Blood Quantum Review: Inspired Splatter
description: You think youve seen every way to dispatch a zombie, and then someone applies a chainsaw to a skull in a particularly satisfying manner.

title: Study Finds Coronavirus in Tiny Airborne Droplets in Wuhan
description: This briefing has ended. Read the latest developments in the coronavirus pandemic here.

Coronavirus, Vaccine, U.S. Death Toll: Your Tuesday Briefing

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: The Assistant and Coronavirus: Explained
description: THE ASSISTANT (2020) Rent or buy on Amazon or iTunes. In this low-key thriller by the filmmaker Kitty Green, Jane (Julia Garner) is an aspiring film producer working as a junior assistant to a major entertainment mogul, who remains unseen but is clearly based on Harvey Weinstein. Jane spends her days doing menial tasks while two other male assistants casually dismiss and disrespect her. The movie slowly simmers with tension as she becomes aware of the abuse and oppression going on in the office and works up the courage to take a stand. Jeannette Catsoulis named the movie a Critics Pick in her review for The New York Times, describing it as a painstaking examination of the way individual slights can coalesce into a suffocating miasma of harassment.

title: A Time to Save the Sick and Rescue the Planet
description: The Covid-19 pandemic is the biggest test the world has faced since World War II. There is a natural tendency in the face of crisis to take care of ones own first. But true leadership understands that there are times to think big and more generously. Such thinking was behind the Marshall Plan and the formation of the United Nations after World War II. This is also such a moment. We must work together as societies and as an international community to save lives, ease suffering and lessen the shattering economic and social consequences of Covid-19.

title: Word + Quiz: harridan
Trevor Noah Doesnt Think Trump Knows What Bleach Is
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Were all stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now..

title: Abortion by Telemedicine: A Growing Option as Access to Clinics Wanes
description: Ashley Dale was grateful she could end her pregnancy at home.

title: Ramadan in Isolation
description: For the worlds 1.8 billion Muslims, the holy month of Ramadan, which began last week, is a social and spiritual high point, a time to gather with friends and family, and to focus on fasting, prayer and scripture.

title: Mekhi Becton, the Jets Top Draft Pick, Moves People Like Furniture
description: When Mekhi Becton signed up for the football team at Highland Springs High School in Virginia, he picked wide receiver and tight end as his positions. He was 6 feet 3 inches tall and weighed 215 pounds.

title: Perus Queen of Quechua Rap Wants to Rescue Indigenous Culture With Her Music
description: The music video begins with the sweeping views of the snow-capped Andes Mountains and the whistle of the regions traditional wind instruments.

title: Marc Benioffs $25 Million Blitz to Buy Protective Gear From China
description: Sam Hawgood, the chancellor of the University of California, San Francisco, was getting concerned.

title: Lesson of the Day: Reopening Has Begun. No One Is Sure What Happens Next.
description: Featured Article: Reopening Has Begun. No One Is Sure What Happens Next. By Ben Casselman

title: Unified in Coronavirus Lockdown, India Splinters Over Reopening
description: NEW DELHI  When the Indian government eased coronavirus restrictions last week, allowing many shops to reopen in rural parts of the country, Uday Shankar Sharma, a retail store owner in a small farming village, said he had no intention of complying.

title: What Are Your Hopes for Summer 2020? What Are Your Worries?
description: How do you typically spend your summer?

title: New & Noteworthy, From Galileo to Dunces
description: WHITEOUT CONDITIONS, by Tariq Shah. (Two Dollar Radio, paper, $14.99.) Funerals are kind of fun, the narrator of Shahs debut admits in the opening pages. Ive cultivated a taste. Then his childhood friend dies, and the narrator must brave a blizzard to pay his respects.

title: This Is What Its Like to Be Homeless in New York City
description: THIS IS ALL I GOTA New Mothers Search for HomeBy Lauren Sandler

title: When Airplanes and Zeppelins Competed to Conquer the Skies
description: EMPIRES OF THE SKYZeppelins, Airplanes, and Two Mens Epic Duel to Rule the WorldBy Alexander Rose

title: When the Towns Future Is an Obsolete Factory
description: NO-SIGNAL AREABy Robert Perisic

title: How Do You Explain Henry Kissinger?
description: THE INEVITABILITY OF TRAGEDYHenry Kissinger and His WorldBy Barry Gewen

title: What Phone Calls Have Given Me That Video Chat Cant
description: My friendship with Alex began as most still do: in person. We met as volunteers at the Housing Works Bookstore Cafe in SoHo, where we talked about novels while alphabetizing the shelves. Before long, we were in friend-love: walking my dog together in Central Park, working together in coffee shops and going on movie dates  until a little over a year ago, when Alex and her husband moved back to Australia. This had always been their plan, yet anticipating the loss didnt dull the experience of it. Our friendship could have transitioned to a neutered, text-only version of itself at that point, as many do, or even ended altogether.

title: Amid Covid-19, Should I Shop for Myself or Opt for Delivery?
description: In this time of lockdown, is it more ethical to order necessary items for delivery or to go get them myself? There are risks to others in both scenarios  whether to the workers or myself and my family. Is ordering for delivery helping to provide work for the delivery people or burdening that system by taking time away from those at higher risk than me? Anne, Boston

title: A Writer Pursues His Subjects as a Hunter Stalks His Prey
description: THE CELESTIAL HUNTERBy Roberto Calasso

title: How to Get Your Balance
description: Your head is extremely heavy, says Mia Noblet, 25, who holds multiple world records for slacklining, including one for walking blindfolded on a one-inch-wide nylon strap stretched 1,539 feet between two towering rock formations in Moab, Utah. To get your balance, stretch out your arms loosely to either side like wings, elbows bent, palms forward. If youre becoming off-kilter, feel free to wave your arms, jut a hip to one side or even kick a leg out  but always keep your head directly above your line. Where your head goes, the rest of your body will follow.

title: A Novel Imagines the Life of the Man Who Discovered Camus
description: OUR RICHES By Kaouther Adimi

title: Can the Trump Campaign Rewrite the Story of the Trump Presidency?
Ohios G.O.P. Governor Splits From Trump, and Rises in Popularity
description: For 40 years, Mike DeWine rose steadily if blandly up the ladder of Ohio politics, finally landing his dream job as governor. He took office last year as a familiar figure in the state, not because of any indelible political identity, but because, at 72, he had been around forever.

title: A Letter From the Contents of My Bra Drawer
description: Dear Elizabeth,

title: Heres What to Trim (and What Not to Touch) From Your Budget Right Now
description: So much has already been cut out of my life in the past month. Restaurant meals, birthday parties, a trip to Joshua Tree, haircuts, yoga classes  even a priceless hug from a friend. But when my work dried up overnight in early April, I realized that one more thing needed to be cut: my expenses.

title: Tuesdays Livestreaming Events: Melrose Place Reunion and Story Time With Tom Hardy
description: Here are a few of the best events happening on Tuesday and how to tune in (all times are Eastern Standard). Updated daily.

title: With Campuses Closed, College Tours Move Online
description: Virtual coffees with college students for high school juniors. Zoom sessions between applicants and admissions officers. Student guides offering welcoming messages in video selfies and scenic views of university campuses captured by drones.

title: Coming Soon: New Fiction From Simone de Beauvoir
description: In her 1963 memoir, Force of Circumstance, Simone de Beauvoir made a fleeting and tantalizing reference to a work of fiction she had abandoned. She described her attempt to write a story centered on her best friend Zaza, who died young of viral encephalitis.

title: Jodie Comer on Her Killer Beauty Regimen
description: Killer acting role leads to killer skin care? Not exactly, but both are true for Jodie Comer, who is known for her role as the sociopathic but charismatic assassin Villanelle on the darkly comic Killing Eve, just back for Season 3. These days, Ms. Comer, 27, is sheltering in place with her family in Liverpool, England, where she grew up. Hear what shes putting on and also cooking up.

title: A Little Family Against the World
description: LITTLE FAMILYBy Ishmael Beah

title: How Congress Can Vote Remotely
description: The coronavirus pandemic has caused unprecedented change to every facet of our lives. Millions of Americans are working remotely, performing the essential functions of their jobs away from their workplaces, often at home. But right now members of Congress cant perform some of the key functions of their job because they are back in their home states and districts, unable to cast votes, debate or hold remote hearings.

title: A Mother, a Pandemic and Scorched Rice
description: Im sending you money to buy rice, my mom texted me in early March. She had gone to the West Coast to help my sister with her new baby and stayed when it became too risky to fly. As news of the coronavirus intensified, so did her fretting.

title: Lets Get Real About Coronavirus Tests
description: In the worlds ongoing quest to respond to the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus, one of the tools most often invoked and hailed is testing  testing for current infections, to determine who is ill and contagious, and testing for antibodies, a sign of past infection and possibly, too, of future immunity.

title: How Trump and His Team Covered Up the Coronavirus in Five Days
description: The strongest critics of the Trump administrations handling of the coronavirus pandemic point to its flat-footedness and the consequences of time lost.

title: My 4-Year-Old Thinks Shes a Sous Chef. Im Trying to Remain Calm.
description: I am what you might generously call a skilled home cook. I can follow recipes, copy pictures, execute a modest range of techniques and improvise a little with decent results. But I am no virtuoso; I have no particular talent for inventing dishes or harmonizing flavors, and even less for creating food that, arriving on the plate, looks appetizing. But its all edible, and for a good stretch of years it was my most reliably relaxing hobby.

title: The Community Cookbook Is Reborn for a Time of Scarcity and Sharing
description: The chef and artist Krystal Macks favorite cookbook has no beautiful photos of food. Its recipes arent professionally tested. Its authors arent food writers or restaurateurs.

title: Nursing Homes Were a Disaster Waiting to Happen
description: It was clear almost from the outset that the elderly and frail were in the greatest danger from Covid-19. And it was clear to anyone familiar with American nursing homes that they would not be up to the task of protecting their older and infirm residents.

title: Want to Learn French? Italian? Russian? Theres No Time Like the Present
description: Its a classic travel fantasy: flying to another country to learn a language through a combination of classes and swanning around, ordering meals at sidewalk cafes, shopping at street markets, slipping into darkened theaters. Yet with much of the world under stay-at-home orders, that dream may seem more distant than ever.

title: Finally Theres Time to Read (or at Least Organize Your Books)
description: Looking to make the most of time spent stuck at home, many of us are turning to books.

title: Hundreds of Miles From Home, Nurses Fight Coronavirus on New Yorks Front Lines
description: Each night at dusk, in an otherwise desolate Times Square, hundreds of nurses in blue scrubs gather to board buses that take them to hospitals across New York City.

title: Theyre Still Working at the Airports, and Theyre Scared
description: Since the coronavirus outbreak began, dozens of workers from the three major airports in the New York City area have been infected, and at least 17 have died, union officials said.

title: There Is No Perfect Way Out of This
description: Gail Collins: Bret, do you listen to Andrew Cuomos daily pandemic press conferences?

title: Dont Be Afraid of Giving Birth in a New York Hospital
description: Two of us enter the hospital, three of us leave, and you tell us how its done safely.

title: Endless Summer Puts Homebound Kids at Risk for Weight Gain
description: With tens of thousands of schools in dozens of states now shuttered through the remainder of the school year because of the coronavirus pandemic, an estimated 55 million students will be home from school for double the length of their normal summer vacations, if not longer.

title: Fired in a Pandemic Because We Tried to Start a Union, Workers Say
description: Truck drivers and warehouse workers at Cort Furniture Rental in New Jersey had spent months trying to unionize in the hopes of securing higher wages and better benefits. By early this year, they thought they were on the cusp of success.

title: How a Digital Ad Strategy That Helped Trump Is Being Used Against Him
description: Facebook users in five key swing states have been seeing a peculiar sequence of political ads pixelating their news feeds for the past six months.

title: Rhode Island Pushes Aggressive Testing, a Move That Could Ease Reopening
description: Rhode Island gives the appearance of a state where the coronavirus is a fire raging, the average number of daily infections more than quadrupling since the start of this month.

title: For Some Holocaust Survivors, Even Liberation Was Dehumanizing
description: The latest article from Beyond the World War II We Know, a series from The Times that documents lesser-known stories from the war, explores the complex and sometimes dehumanizing interactions between the concentration camp prisoners and the Allied soldiers who liberated them.

title: Coronavirus Diplomacy: How Chinas Red Cross Serves the Communist Party
description: Donations flooded in to fight the virus devastating the city of Wuhan, and the ruling Communist Party directed them to a group it could trust: the Chinese Red Cross.

title: 5 Minutes That Will Make You Love Opera
description: In the past, weve asked some of our favorite artists to choose the five minutes or so theyd play to make their friends fall in love with classical music and the piano.

title: The Marine Corps Battles for Its Identity, Over Women in Boot Camp
description: PARRIS ISLAND, S.C.  Stretched above the main boulevard on this historic training base in the Mid-Atlantic marsh is a white and black-lettered sign: WE MAKE MARINES.

title: The Celestial Hunter, by Roberto Calasso: An Excerpt
description: In the time of the Great Raven even the invisible was visible. And it continually transformed itself. Animals, at that time, were not necessarily animals. They might happen to be animals, but sometimes they were humans, gods, lords of a species, demons, ancestors. And humans werent necessarily humans but could also be the transient form of something else. There were no tricks for recognizing those that appeared. They had to be already known, as one knows a friend or an adversary. Everything, from spiders to the dead, occurred within a single flow of forms. It was the realm of metamorphosis.

title: Little Family, by Ishmael Beah: An Excerpt
description: If you are to walk toward a field that lies at the edge of the small town of Foloiya when the sun is awake in the sky, you will hear the breeze whistling through the grasses, parting the dry and green strands as it makes its way to you. Or maybe you will think it is the rustling of someone hiding under the vast shrubs. At the end of the field, your eyes will light upon the face of a boy among the grasses, peering intently at something. You try to see what it is by following the trail of his gaze, but you see nothing.

title: Should People Without Coronavirus Antibodies Be Second-Class Citizens?
description: One of us tested positive for the coronavirus. The other one probably had it, too  we are married and live together  although symptoms were mild. We both were fortunate to recover.
